title: WCAS HISTORY 300-0-30 New Lectures in History

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will examine the economic history of Europe from the middle ages to the ninteenth Century with themes including the emergence of large trading networks in medieval europe, the development of sovereign credit markets and joint-stock companies in the early modern period, and the economics of war in later centuries. The readings will consist of a number of books and essays.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades are based on three criteria: Attendence and Participation (10%), three short papers (60%) and one final exam (30%).

subject: HISTORY
